thread.title: OnePlus gets taste of own medicine
thread.title_full: OnePlus gets taste of own medicine

author: Hadlee Simons
title: OnePlus gets taste of own medicine
text:
Are you covered? Compare quotes for car, life and business insurance right now! 
Sign up for your free fax number and get faxes sent to your inbox! OnePlus gets taste of own medicine Article By: Hadlee Simons Wed, 21 Oct 2015 8:17 AM Share Your Email The Meizu MX5 PRO. 
Mobile manufacturer OnePlus is known for its cheeky marketing, with its #TakeTheEdgeOff campaign being the latest. 
The company is offering a free OnePlus Two smartphone to people who trade in their Galaxy S6, Galaxy S6 Edge, Galaxy Note 5 or Galaxy S6 Edge+, Android Authority reported. 
Now, prominent Chinese firm Meizu is targeting OnePlus in a similar campaign, called #TurnTheHeatOff - perhaps a knock against the chip used in the OnePlus Two. 
Meizu is calling on OnePlus Two owners to swap their new phone for a new Meizu PRO 5 smartphone. 
And it seems like a rather great deal, as the PRO 5 packs the same Exynos 7420 chip seen in the S6 range, 3 or 4GBs of RAM (depending on variant), a 5.7-inch full HD display and a 21MP/5MP camera pairing. 
Other specifications include USB Type C support, fast charging, a 3050mAh battery and a fingerprint scanner. 
In fact, the MX5 PRO is slightly more expensive than the OnePlus Two... Related Articles
